content.question:
Iucundum, mea vita, mihi proponis amorem

hunc nostrum inter nos perpetuumque fore.

Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit,

atque id sincere dicat et ex animo.

1 . Referring specifically to the Latin in lines 1-2 (Iucundum . . . fore), identify two characteristics of the love proposed by the addressee to Catullus.

frqParts.text:
Iucundum, mea vita, mihi proponis amorem

hunc nostrum inter nos perpetuumque fore.

Di magni, facite ut vere promittere possit,

atque id sincere dicat et ex animo.

1 . Referring specifically to the Latin in lines 1-2 (Iucundum . . . fore), identify two characteristics of the love proposed by the addressee to Catullus.
2. What two things does Catullus ask the gods to do in lines 3-4 (Di . . . animo)? Write out and translate two Latin clauses to support your answer.
3. Write out and scan line 4 (atque . . . animo).

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
